1.text: And again he began to teach by the sea side. And there is gathered unto him a very great multitude, so that he entered into a boat, and sat in the sea; and all the multitude were by the sea on the land.

2.text: And he taught them many things in parables, and said unto them in his teaching,

3.text: Hearken: Behold, the sower went forth to sow:

4.text: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some seed fell by the way side, and the birds came and devoured it.

5.text: And other fell on the rocky ground, where it had not much earth; and straightway it sprang up, because it had no deepness of earth:

6.text: and when the sun was risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

7.text: And other fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

8.text: And others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing; and brought forth, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.

9.text: And he said, Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

10.text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parables.

11.text: And he said unto them, Unto you is given the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all things are done in parables:

12.text: that seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest haply they should turn again, and it should be forgiven them.

13.text: And he saith unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how shall ye know all the parables?

15.text: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; and when they have heard, straightway cometh Satan, and taketh away the word which hath been sown in them.

16.text: And these in like manner are they that are sown upon the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, straightway receive it with joy;

17.text: and they have no root in themselves, but endure for a while; then, when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, straightway they stumble.

18.text: And others are they that are sown among the thorns; these are they that have heard the word,

19.text: and the cares of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

20.text: And those are they that were sown upon the good ground; such as hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.

21.text: And he said unto them, Is the lamp brought to be put under the bushel, or under the bed, and not to be put on the stand?

22.text: For there is nothing hid, save that it should be manifested; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

23.text: If any man hath ears to hear, let him hear.

24.text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete it shall be measured unto you: and more shall be given unto you.

25.text: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.

26.text: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed upon the earth;

27.text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he knoweth not how.

28.text: The earth beareth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, then the full corn in the ear.

29.text: But when the fruit is ripe, straightway he putteth forth the sickle, because the harvest is come.

30.text: And he said, How shall we liken the kingdom of God? or in what parable shall we set it forth?

31.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown upon the earth, though it be less than all the seeds that are upon the earth,

32.text: yet when it is sown, groweth up, and becometh greater than all the herbs, and putteth out great branches; so that the birds of the heaven can lodge under the shadow thereof.

33.text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it:

34.text: and without a parable spake he not unto them: but privately to his own disciples he expounded all things.

35.text: And on that day, when even was come, he saith unto them, Let us go over unto the other side.

36.text: And leaving the multitude, they take him with them, even as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.

37.text: And there ariseth a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the boat, insomuch that the boat was now filling.

38.text: And he himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?

39.text: And he awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

40.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye fearful? have ye not yet faith?

41.text: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
